flawed_nl_solution:
If it was 10 degrees hotter on this day in Miami than in New York, then the temperature in Miami was 80+10 = 90 degrees.
If it was 25 degrees cooler in Miami than in San Diego, then the temperature in San Diego was 90+25 = <<90+25=112>>112 degrees.
The total temperature for all the cities is 112+90+80 = <<112+90+80=282>>282 degrees
The average temperature of the three cities is 282/3 = <<282/3=94>>94 degrees
#### 94

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 115, not 112. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
